   19: %%
   20: -module(group_leader_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: -compile(export_all).
   23: 
   24: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   25: 
   26: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   27: %% @spec suite() -> Info
   28: %% Info = [tuple()]
   29: %% @end
   30: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   31: suite() ->
   32:     [{timetrap,{seconds,10}}].
   33: 
   34: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   35: %% @spec init_per_suite(Config0) ->
   36: %%     Config1 | {skip,Reason} | {skip_and_save,Reason,Config1}
   37: %% Config0 = Config1 = [tuple()]
   38: %% Reason = term()
   39: %% @end
   40: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   41: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   42:     start_my_io_server(),
   43:     Config.
   44: 
   45: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   46: %% @spec end_per_suite(Config0) -> void() | {save_config,Config1}
   47: %% Config0 = Config1 = [tuple()]
   48: %% @end
   49: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   50: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   51:     my_io_server ! die,
   52:     ok.
   53: 
   54: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   55: %% @spec init_per_group(GroupName, Config0) ->
   56: %%               Config1 | {skip,Reason} | {skip_and_save,Reason,Config1}
   57: %% GroupName = atom()
   58: %% Config0 = Config1 = [tuple()]
   59: %% Reason = term()
   60: %% @end
   61: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   62: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   63:     Config.
   64: 
   65: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   66: %% @spec end_per_group(GroupName, Config0) ->
   67: %%               void() | {save_config,Config1}
   68: %% GroupName = atom()
   69: %% Config0 = Config1 = [tuple()]
   70: %% @end
   71: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   72: end_per_group(_GroupName, _Config) ->
   73:     ok.
   74: 
   75: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   76: %% @spec init_per_testcase(TestCase, Config0) ->
   77: %%               Config1 | {skip,Reason} | {skip_and_save,Reason,Config1}
   78: %% TestCase = atom()
   79: %% Config0 = Config1 = [tuple()]
   80: %% Reason = term()
   81: %% @end
   82: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   83: init_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->
   84:     Config.
   85: 
   86: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   87: %% @spec end_per_testcase(TestCase, Config0) ->
   88: %%               void() | {save_config,Config1} | {fail,Reason}
   89: %% TestCase = atom()
   90: %% Config0 = Config1 = [tuple()]
   91: %% Reason = term()
   92: %% @end
   93: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   94: end_per_testcase(_TestCase, _Config) ->
   95:     ok.
   96: 
   97: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   98: %% @spec groups() -> [Group]
   99: %% Group = {GroupName,Properties,GroupsAndTestCases}
  100: %% GroupName = atom()
  101: %% Properties = [parallel | sequence | Shuffle | {RepeatType,N}]
  102: %% GroupsAndTestCases = [Group | {group,GroupName} | TestCase]
  103: %% TestCase = atom()
  104: %% Shuffle = shuffle | {shuffle,{integer(),integer(),integer()}}
  105: %% RepeatType = repeat | repeat_until_all_ok | repeat_until_all_fail |
  106: %%              repeat_until_any_ok | repeat_until_any_fail
  107: %% N = integer() | forever
  108: %% @end
  109: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  110: groups() ->
  111:     [{p,[parallel],[p1,p2]},
  112:      {p_restart,[parallel],[p_restart_my_io_server]},
  113:      {seq,[],[s1,s2,s3]},
  114:      {seq2,[],[s4,s5]},
  115:      {seq_in_par,[parallel],[p10,p11,{group,seq},p12,{group,seq2},p13]},
  116:      {capture_io,[parallel],[cap1,cap2]},
  117:      {unexpected_io,[parallel],[unexp1,unexp2]}].
  118: 
  119: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  120: %% @spec all() -> GroupsAndTestCases | {skip,Reason}
  121: %% GroupsAndTestCases = [{group,GroupName} | TestCase]
  122: %% GroupName = atom()
  123: %% TestCase = atom()
  124: %% Reason = term()
  125: %% @end
  126: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  127: all() ->
  128:     [tc1,{group,p},{group,p_restart},p3,
  129:      {group,seq_in_par},
  130:      cap1,cap2,
  131:      {group,capture_io},
  132:      {group,unexpected_io}].
  133: 
  134: tc1(_C) ->
  135:     ok.
  136: 
  137: p1(_) ->
  138:     %% OTP-10101:
  139:     %%
  140:     %% External apps/processes started by init_per_suite (common operation),
  141:     %% will inherit the group leader of the init_per_suite process, i.e. the
  142:     %% test_server test case control process (executing run_test_case_msgloop/7).
  143:     %% If, later, a parallel test case triggers the external app to print with
  144:     %% e.g. io:format() (also common operation), the calling process will hang!
  145:     %% The reason for this is that a parallel test case has a dedicated IO
  146:     %% server process, other than the central test case control process. The
  147:     %% latter process is not executing run_test_case_msgloop/7 and will not
  148:     %% respond to IO messages. The process is still group leader for the
  149:     %% external app, however, which is wrong. It's the IO process for the
  150:     %% parallel test case that should be group leader - but only for the
  151:     %% particular invocation, since other parallel test cases could be
  152:     %% invoking the external app too.
  153:     print("hej\n").
  154: 
  155: p2(_) ->
  156:     print("hopp\n").
  157: 
  158: p_restart_my_io_server(_) ->
  159:     %% Restart the IO server and change its group leader. This used
  160:     %% to set to the group leader to a process that would soon die.
  161:     Ref = erlang:monitor(process, my_io_server),
  162:     my_io_server ! die,
  163:     receive
  164: 	{'DOWN',Ref,_,_,_} ->
  165: 	    start_my_io_server()
  166:     end.
  167: 
  168: p3(_) ->
  169:     %% OTP-10125. This would crash since the group leader process
  170:     %% for the my_io_server had died.
  171:     print("hoppsan\n").
  172: 
  173: print(String) ->
  174:     my_io_server ! {print,self(),String},
  175:     receive
  176: 	{printed,String} ->
  177: 	    ok
  178:     end.
  179: 
  180: start_my_io_server() ->
  181:     Parent = self(),
  182:     Pid = spawn(fun() -> my_io_server(Parent) end),
  183:     receive
  184: 	{Pid,started} ->
  185: 	    io:format("~p\n", [process_info(Pid)]),
  186: 	    ok
  187:     end.
  188: 
  189: my_io_server(Parent) ->
  190:     register(my_io_server, self()),
  191:     Parent ! {self(),started},
  192:     my_io_server_loop().
  193: 
  194: my_io_server_loop() ->
  195:     receive
  196: 	{print,From,String} ->
  197: 	    io:put_chars(String),
  198: 	    From ! {printed,String},
  199: 	    my_io_server_loop();
  200: 	die ->
  201: 	    ok
  202:     end.
  203: 
  204: p10(_) ->
  205:     receive after 1 -> ok end.
  206: 
  207: p11(_) ->
  208:     ok.
  209: 
  210: p12(_) ->
  211:     ok.
  212: 
  213: p13(_) ->
  214:     ok.
  215: 
  216: s1(_) ->
  217:     ok.
  218: 
  219: s2(_) ->
  220:     ok.
  221: 
  222: s3(_) ->
  223:     ok.
  224: 
  225: s4(_) ->
  226:     ok.
  227: 
  228: s5(_) ->
  229:     ok.
  230: 
  231: cap1(_) ->
  232:     ct:capture_start(),
  233:     IO = gen_io(cap1, 10, []),
  234:     ct:capture_stop(),
  235:     IO = ct:capture_get(),
  236:     ok.
  237: 
  238: cap2(_) ->
  239:     ct:capture_start(),
  240:     {Pid,Ref} = spawn_monitor(fun() ->
  241: 				      exit(gen_io(cap2, 42, []))
  242: 			      end),
  243:     receive
  244: 	{'DOWN',Ref,process,Pid,IO} ->
  245: 	    ct:capture_stop(),
  246: 	    IO = ct:capture_get(),
  247: 	    ok
  248:     end.
  249: 
  250: gen_io(_, 0, Acc) ->
  251:     lists:reverse(Acc);
  252: gen_io(Label, N, Acc) ->
  253:     S = lists:flatten(io_lib:format("~s: ~p\n", [Label,N])),
  254:     io:put_chars(S),
  255:     gen_io(Label, N-1, [S|Acc]).
  256: 
  257: %% Test that unexpected I/O is sent to test_server's unexpeced_io log.
  258: %% To trigger this, run two test cases in parallel and send a printout
  259: %% (via ct logging functions) from an external process which has a
  260: %% different group leader than the test cases.
  261: unexp1(Config) ->
  262:     ct:sleep(1000),
  263:     gen_unexp_io(),
  264:     ct:sleep(1000),
  265:     check_unexp_io(Config),
  266:     ok.
  267: 
  268: unexp2(_) ->
  269:     ct:sleep(2000),
  270:     ok.
  271: 
  272: gen_unexp_io() ->
  273:     spawn(fun() ->
  274: 		  group_leader(whereis(user),self()),
  275: 		  ct:log("-x- Unexpected io ct:log -x-",[]),
  276: 		  ct:pal("-x- Unexpected io ct:pal -x-",[]),
  277: 		  ok
  278: 	  end).
  279: 
  280: check_unexp_io(Config) ->
  281:     SuiteLog = ?config(tc_logfile,Config),
  282:     Dir = filename:dirname(SuiteLog),
  283:     UnexpLog = filename:join(Dir,"unexpected_io.log.html"),
  284:     {ok,SuiteBin} = file:read_file(SuiteLog),
  285:     nomatch = re:run(SuiteBin,"-x- Unexpected io ",[global,{capture,none}]),
  286:     {ok,UnexpBin} = file:read_file(UnexpLog),
  287:     {match,[_,_]} = re:run(UnexpBin,"-x- Unexpected io ",[global]),
  288:     ok.
